articles.headline: Vaccine Maker Earned Record Profits but Delivered Disappointment in Return
articles.snippet: Emergent BioSolutions was awarded a $628 million federal contract with no competitive bidding. Top executives received big bonuses while factories mostly sat idle and tens of millions of Covid-19 doses were thrown away.
articles.abstract: Emergent BioSolutions was awarded a $628 million federal contract with no competitive bidding. Top executives received big bonuses while factories mostly sat idle and tens of millions of Covid-19 doses were thrown away.
articles.lead_paragraph: Record profits warranted record bonuses. That was the recommendation in January by executives at the biotech firm Emergent BioSolutions. The board of directors agreed, signing off on nearly $8 million in cash and stock awards for five company leaders.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere, Chris Hamby and Rebecca R. Ruiz

articles.headline: Victoria’s Secret Swaps Angels for ‘What Women Want.’ Will They Buy It?
articles.snippet: The embattled lingerie giant is attempting the most extreme brand turnaround in recent memory: an effort to redefine not just itself but also the very idea of what “sexy” is.
articles.abstract: The embattled lingerie giant is attempting the most extreme brand turnaround in recent memory: an effort to redefine not just itself but also the very idea of what “sexy” is.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Victoria’s Secret Angels, those avatars of Barbie bodies and playboy reverie, are gone. Their wings, fluttery confections of rhinestones and feathers that could weigh almost 30 pounds, are gathering dust in storage. The “Fantasy Bra,” dangling real diamonds and other gems, is no more.
articles.byline: By Sapna Maheshwari and Vanessa Friedman

articles.headline: One of Big Tech’s Biggest Critics Is Now Its Regulator
articles.snippet: Lina Khan is the most progressive chair of the Federal Trade Commission in at least a generation.
articles.abstract: Lina Khan is the most progressive chair of the Federal Trade Commission in at least a generation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One of Lina Khan’s first projects as a new staff member at an antitrust think tank in 2011 was researching the history of the market for books, which had increasingly been dominated by Amazon. It was an early, unpublished entry in a body of work that has since established her as a major critic of the tech giants and corporate concentration.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: Biden and Putin Express Desire for Better Relations at Summit Shaped by Disputes
articles.snippet: After their first summit meeting, the two leaders described each other with respect but resolved none of the disagreements that have sent U.S.-Russian ties to their lowest level since the Cold War.
articles.abstract: After their first summit meeting, the two leaders described each other with respect but resolved none of the disagreements that have sent U.S.-Russian ties to their lowest level since the Cold War.
articles.lead_paragraph: GENEVA — A highly anticipated first summit meeting between President Biden and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia ended early on Wednesday and was described by both sides as a series of polite but adamantly stated disagreements about which country is the greater force of global disruption.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Michael D. Shear and Anton Troianovski

articles.headline: Southern Baptist Vote Signals Further Fractures in American Evangelicalism
articles.snippet: The establishment narrowly headed off a takeover attempt by a hard-right movement. Some backers of the losing candidate are now considering leaving altogether.
articles.abstract: The establishment narrowly headed off a takeover attempt by a hard-right movement. Some backers of the losing candidate are now considering leaving altogether.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: With Putin, Biden Tries to Forge a Bond of Self-Interest, Not Souls
articles.snippet: Theirs seems likely to be a strained and frustrating association, one where the two leaders may maintain a veneer of civil discourse even as they joust on the international stage.
articles.abstract: Theirs seems likely to be a strained and frustrating association, one where the two leaders may maintain a veneer of civil discourse even as they joust on the international stage.
articles.lead_paragraph: No one peered admiringly into anyone’s soul. No one called anyone a killer. By all appearances, President Biden’s much-anticipated meeting with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was not warm, but neither was it hot.

articles.headline: For Republicans, ‘Crisis’ Is the Message as the Outrage Machine Ramps Up
articles.snippet: With next year’s midterm elections seen as a referendum on Democratic rule, Republicans are seeking to create a sense of instability and overreach, diverting focus from their own divisions.
articles.abstract: With next year’s midterm elections seen as a referendum on Democratic rule, Republicans are seeking to create a sense of instability and overreach, diverting focus from their own divisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republican leaders would like everyone to know that the nation is in crisis.

articles.headline: He Warned Apple About the Risks in China. Then They Became Reality.
articles.snippet: Doug Guthrie, once one of America’s leading China bulls, rang the alarm on doing business there. He spoke about his time at Apple.
articles.abstract: Doug Guthrie, once one of America’s leading China bulls, rang the alarm on doing business there. He spoke about his time at Apple.
articles.lead_paragraph: Doug Guthrie spent 1994 riding a single-speed bicycle between factories in Shanghai for a dissertation on Chinese industry. Within years, he was one of America’s leading experts on China’s turn toward capitalism and was helping companies venture East.

articles.headline: Affordable Care Act Survives Latest Supreme Court Challenge
articles.snippet: The court sidestepped the larger issue in the case, whether the 2010 health care law can stand without a provision that required most Americans to obtain insurance or pay a penalty.
articles.abstract: The court sidestepped the larger issue in the case, whether the 2010 health care law can stand without a provision that required most Americans to obtain insurance or pay a penalty.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Affordable Care Act on Thursday survived a third major challenge as the Supreme Court, on a 7-to-2 vote, turned aside the latest effort by Republicans to kill the health care law.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Backs Catholic Agency in Case on Gay Rights and Foster Care
articles.snippet: The unanimous ruling was further evidence that claims of religious liberty almost always prevail in the current court.
articles.abstract: The unanimous ruling was further evidence that claims of religious liberty almost always prevail in the current court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court ruled unanimously on Thursday that a Catholic social services agency in Philadelphia could defy city rules and refuse to work with same-sex couples who apply to take in foster children.
